page.title: 20Retirement Festivities
page.content: A social evening was held at the village hall on 26th July 1985 to mark the retirement of the local Vicar,Rev. A.W.McAdam. The local people raised over Â£550 to buy him a music centre. During the evening a local artist, Mr.Sweetingham,gave an amusing account of various stages and happenings in the Vicar's life.He had portrayed these events in cartoons which were displayed for all the gathering to enjoy.Mrs McAdam was presented with a portrait of her husband which had been painted by the same artist. A splendid buffet was provided for everyone. The evening ended with a glass of sherry and a piece of cake, and the toast-'Happy Birthday,Vicar'. Mr and Mrs McAdam will continue to live in Grosmont.
